sen.j: 松田 道之（まつだ みちゆき、天保10年5月12日 (旧暦)（1839年6月22日） - 明治15年（1882年）7月6日）は、日本の内務官僚・政治家。
sen.e: Michiyuki MATSUDA (June 22, 1839 - July 6, 1882) was a government official of the Ministry of Home Affairs and a statesman in Japan.
Michiyuki MATSUDA (June 22, 1839 - July 6, 1882) was a government official of the Ministry of Home Affairs and a statesman in Japan.
Michiyuki MATSUDA (June 22, 1839 - July 6, 1882) was a government official of the Ministry of Home Affairs and a statesman in Japan.

sen.j: 大津県令、滋賀県令（初代）、東京府知事（第7代）などを務めた。
sen.e: He served as the prefectural governor of Otsu and Shiga (the first governor), and the (seventh) Governor of Tokyo Prefecture.
He served as the prefectural governor of Otsu and Shiga (the first governor), and the (seventh) Governor of Tokyo Prefecture.
He served as the prefectural governor of Otsu and Shiga (the first governor), and the (seventh) Governor of Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 沖縄県の歴史琉球処分において中心的な役割を果たしたことで知られる。
sen.e: He was known for playing a pivotal role in the Ryukyu Annexation in the history of Okinawa Prefecture.
He was known for playing a pivotal role in the Ryukyu Annexation in the history of Okinawa Prefecture.
He was known for playing a pivotal role in the Ryukyu Annexation in the history of Okinawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 鳥取藩家老・鵜殿氏の家臣久保居明の次子として生まれ藩医木下主計にはじめ養われのち松田市太夫の嗣子となる。
sen.e: He was born the second son of Akira KUBOI, a vassal of the Udono clan, Karo (chief retainer) of Tottori Domain and then became an heir of Ichidayu MATSUDA after he was first raised by Kazue KINOSHITA, a doctor of the Domain.
sen.cmt: 久保居明の読み不明鵜殿氏<http://members2.jcom.home.ne.jp/sengokubusyou/udonosisyou.html>松田市太夫<http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%9D%BE%E7%94%B0%E5%B8%82%E5%A4%AA%E5%A4%AB>木下主計<http://cozalweb.com/ctv/doumei/kazue.html>
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Akira KUBOI, a vassal of the Udono clan, Karo (chief retainer) of Tottori Domain and then became an heir of Ichidayu MATSUDA after he was first raised by Kazue KINOSHITA, a doctor of the Domain.
sen.cmt: born as に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Akira KUBOI, a vassal of the Udono clan, Karo (chief retainer) of Tottori Domain and then became an heir of Ichidayu MATSUDA after he was first raised by Kazue KINOSHITA, a doctor of the Domain.
He studied at Kangien.
He studied at Kangien.
He studied at Kangien.

sen.j: 幕末は尊皇攘夷運動に傾倒し、明治維新後に内務官僚となる。
sen.e: He devoted himself to the movement of "Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians" in the end of Edo Period and became an official of the Ministry of Home Affairs after the Meiji Restoration.
He devoted himself to the movement of "Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians" in the end of Edo Period and became an official of the Ministry of Home Affairs after the Meiji Restoration.
He devoted himself to the movement of "Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians" in the end of Edo Period and became an official of the Ministry of Home Affairs after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 内務大書記官、京都府大参事、内務大丞などを経て1871年、大津県令に就任。
sen.e: After he held various posts of the Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, Daisanji (second to a governor) of Kyoto Prefecture and Senior Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, he became the prefectural governor of Otsu in 1871.

After he held various posts of the Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, Daisanji (second to a governor) of Kyoto Prefecture and Senior Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, he became the prefectural governor of Otsu in 1871.

After he held various posts of the Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, Daisanji (second to a governor) of Kyoto Prefecture and Senior Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, he became the prefectural governor of Otsu in 1871.
He became the prefectural governor of Shiga in 1872.
He became the prefectural governor of Shiga in 1872.
He became the prefectural governor of Shiga in 1872.

sen.j: 1875年、琉球処分官として沖縄を視察。
sen.e: He visited Okinawa as an official for the Ryukyu Annexation.
He visited Okinawa as an official for the Ryukyu Annexation in 1875.
He visited Okinawa as an official for the Ryukyu Annexation in 1875.

sen.j: 以後1879年まで、琉球処分官として3回沖縄を訪問し、1879年の琉球処分断行に尽力した。
sen.e: Since then, he had visited Okinawa as the official for the Ryukyu Annexation three times until 1879, and made efforts to carry out the Ryukyu Annexation in 1879.
Since then, he had visited Okinawa as the official for the Ryukyu Annexation three times until 1879, and made efforts to carry out the Ryukyu Annexation in 1879.
Since then, he had visited Okinawa as the official for the Ryukyu Annexation three times until 1879, and made efforts to carry out the Ryukyu Annexation in 1879.

sen.j: 同年、東京府知事に就任。
sen.e: In the same year, he became the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture.
In the same year, he became the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture.
In the same year, he became the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture.
He died young in 1882.
He died young in 1882.
